Posts.Content: Hi. I was in exactly the same situation 4 years ago. November 2014 I found a red patch of skin on right Breast. I’m in the UK so had to wait several months for tests. Nothing found in Breast tissue, but I had swelling in lymph nodes by the time I saw a Breast specialist in April 2015. Surgeon described it as “Occult axillary lymphadenopathy, with Cancer of unknown primary”. Plain English - Breast Cancer with no tumour. All Cancer cells were restricted to lymph nodes only. I was really lucky they hadn’t spread beyond the lymph nodes, since i’d probably had it for 5 months by this point. Treatment plan was 6 cycles of Chemo - 3xFEC and 3xTaxotere. All 23 axillary lymph nodes removed - no mastectomy (surgeon felt it unnecessary as no tumour), 15 sessions of Radiotherapy. I’m HER2+ so a year of Herceptin and 10 years of Tamoxifen. Annual check ups with all tests have still not found a primary tumour. Currently in remission and only reminders - apart from the daily pills - is a crescent shaped scar under my arm and a head of hair that steadfastly refuses to grow back to a consistency beyond fine candy floss. I’ve had people question if I ever had Breast Cancer and at times I think it was all some mad dream as I have very few long term side effects and nothing that shows physically. I’ve been told by more than one Oncologist that this type of Cancer is exceptionally rare and have medical students regularly come in to consultations. The key seems to be that if it’s confined to lymph nodes, as one Onc said “it’s a very treatable form of the disease”. Can’t advise on the cost i’m afraid as in the UK so National Health Service picks up the bill. Good luck with your treatment. L
Posts.Title: Breast cancer in lymph node but not in breast
